website_summaries.verdict: A solid 3-outlet timer by a top name in the industry that provides precisely timed watering, sturdy construction, and versatile use. A great option for conserving water and saving some money thanks to its affordable price.
pros: Has a built-in rain delay with settings for 24, 48, or 72 hours
Can easily be used manually without programmed time interruptions
Also easy to set watering duration times for customized needs
cons: Issues with leaks and timing malfunctions have been reported after several months of use, but many consumers found the company attentive when issues arise

customer_reviews.title: If you get this, you also need this
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent but shuts the water off abruptly, causing water hammer (which makes a loud noise and can damage your pipes.). Here's a picture of my setup; spend another $10 and also get this: Sioux Chief Mfg 660-H 3/4-Inch Female Swivel Hose Thread by 3/4-Inch Male Hose Thread Mini Rester
customer_reviews.author: Weights and Protein Shakes

customer_reviews.title: The unit did not stop the water once time period ended...
customer_reviews.text: The unit did not stop the water once time period ended and it ran for hours and hours wide open. Turning it from auto to off still did not stop the water so I had to turn off the water valve. Bought June 7th 2017 and already not working right. I will attempt to return/exchange defective product. 7-26-17 Being sent a replacement and will see how this one does. 10/17/17 Replacement outlet has now also failed and flooded my yard with 1000's of gallons of water... trying to get refund since time frame has passed for return. I have had the 2 port design and it has never failed must be a single port flaw.
customer_reviews.author: sassy

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes doesnt shut the water off
customer_reviews.text: Beware! If you use this on automatic know it sometimes does not shut the water off. This has happened to me twice with two different units. I returned the first and got a replacement; I'd had the second too long. In each case the unit worked perfectly several times then just didn't shut the water off. Water was on four hours one time, six the next. Both units appear to work now - but I don't use them (water hydrant is shut off) unless I can verify they have turned on and off as they should. If you use them on automatic I recommend you do the same!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I liked this so well I bought 2. They worked well. At the end of the season, because we have moderately cold winters in Rhode island, I brought them in, removed the batteries, cleaned them up and stored them in the basement on my workbench (room temperature). Both broke at the piece of plastic that connects the unit to the outside faucet when I hooked them up next the following year. Maybe 1 year is the life expectancy now. Nice design design--poor construction. Orbit must hope noone ever reads these 1-star reviews
customer_reviews.author: H Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 32 days.
customer_reviews.text: Item failed to operate after 32 days. Electronics failed. Item used in partly shaded area on standard 45-60 psi waterline. One cycle per day. Showed low battery three days ago so we changed out new Amazon Basic Alkaline batteries. Product Failed again and changed batteries two more times with Amazon batteries. Same result. Tried calling support, NO help. Just lost $40.00.
customer_reviews.author: slobear

customer_reviews.title: Not functional in hot weather
customer_reviews.text: Exactly 30 days after delivery, this thing is busted. Water spews out of the plastic. The description says that it will function in up to 120 degree weather, but the first time we had a day over 100 degrees, water started leaking from the plastic housing. Too late to return it, so I blew $25 on NOTHING.
customer_reviews.author: A. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: It was nicely packaged with easy to follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the reviews. I'm using it to water my peppers and tomatoes via soaking hose, and I just got it hooked up yesterday. It was nicely packaged with easy to follow instructions. It worked yesterday just fine. I went out this morning to make sure it was still working (water cycle is set to twice a day for 1 hr. There is band of the display in the middle that no longer appears to function. See attached picture. I'll try pulling out the batteries to 'power cycle' it and see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Computerized Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Broken within weeks
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. I noticed twice that it was spontaneously "manually" on twice. I resolved to monitor and try to confirm but most recently, it fails completely to power up. Primary symptom is I can set the clock, but as soon as I start to set the turn-on time, a low battery warning flashes onto the lower right hand corner of the screen. Alkaline batteries, as specified in the instructions, are inserted correctly. The pattern is repeatable...set clock,...then set start time and it fails. Apparently the low price is too good to be (reliable).
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Milner

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 10 days, and then stopped, indicating low batteries. After replacing the batteries with new ones, the same thing immediately happened. The display turned on as if it was OK, but within a minute it indicated low batteries and the display turned off completely. I suspect the problem is caused by unreliable contacts between the batter carrier and the internal electronics, probably related to the fact that the battery compartment is not really waterproof. I also recently bought the Instapark PWT-07 faucet controller which is similar in function and general appearance, but which looks somewhat more waterproof - it's still working after 3 weeks. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but I'm not sure it will last.
customer_reviews.text: Modern farmstead approved! I use this to automatically water the garden, and I use the second one to automatically water tree cuttings. I have been very pleased with this. It saves me loads of time and I don't even have to worry about it. One less chore on the farm that I have to take care of. My only concern is longevity. It already appears to be weathering a bit, and I don't know if it'll last more than a few seasons. It's made out of cheap plastic, but overall I'm happy and it works!
customer_reviews.author: BigRig

customer_reviews.title: shut off problem. WUHAN GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT TRUST THIS PIECE OF CRAP. I'VE WRITTEN SEVERAL REVIEWS AND THEN FELT BAD THAT OK, MAYBE THE ONE OF 5 WAS JUST A FACTORY DEFECT. THEN IT WAS 2, THEN 3, NOW I GO OUT AND I HAD SET THIS DAMN THING AT NOON TODAY FOR 100 MIN'S. ALMOST 8:30 AND MY PROPERTY IS FLOODED. NO MORE AND IN THE A.M. I'LL TAKE THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE AND SMASH IT WITH A SLEDGE HAMMER LIKE I DID THE OTHERS, 3 OUT OF 5 BAD - IS NOT A GOOD NUMBER. SCREW ORBIT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DAMN CRAP HAS COST ME A COUPLE HUNDRED DOLLARS IN WATER BILLS.
customer_reviews.author: Warren B. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Leaking everwhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these and 1 works perfectly and 1 leaks everywhere. Not sure if it's a quality control issue or what but it definitely does not give me peace of mind buying these seeing 1 arrived not working properly. I noticed another review talking about the leaking issue as well and how to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Greeko76

customer_reviews.title: good for only one season, then self destructed.
customer_reviews.text: After one season of successful use, this timer completely fell apart. Stored in the heated basement drained of all water for the winter, when I set it back up in the spring it was as if all of the internal seals had gone bad. Instead of waiting for me to turn on one of the zones, when I turned on the water at the faucet, water leaked from all of the outlets and from every crack in the housing. The whole thing filled with water which must have damaged the electronics. Even after drying everything out and trying again, the timers never worked right and it randomly leaked water.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this timer just under two months. It worked fine for a while. When it stopped, I saw the low battery symbol, so I put in new batteries. I had only half way completed the set up process when the screen went blank and showed the battery symbol again. I got batteries from a fresh package and got the same results. It is completely dead. I expected it to last much longer than two months. I am extremely disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Clock - Simple to Use and Install
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watering timer for a year and the clock has not varied more than a minute or two during that time. Watering cycles are reliable. The LCD screen displays the programming options clearly. Programming is intuitive without need to study instructions. I did run into a minor installation hitch. The included intake combination screen/washer to keep debris out of the valve will not fit onto a standard anti-siphon valve or a 1/2" sill cock. Therefore, I had to remove the screen and replace it with just a hose washer. Since all of our incoming water is already filtered down to a few microns this is not a problem for us.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis A Edge Jr

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Edited review. Product failed after 2 weeks. Failed with the water valve open. Flooded my garden overnight. It did say it had a low battery, which is weird after just 2 weeks. Maybe because it was trying to close the valve? I replaced the batteries but no, it is stuck open. Returned. Now that I look at other recent reviews, it looks like this product has a quality problem now.
customer_reviews.author: tehmod

customer_reviews.title: Best available single timer
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these in regular operation that I use to irrigate a field area. Two I have had for a few years and two I added this year based on the quality of the ones I already had. They hold up to weather exposure very well. I have them synchronized so that one comes on 5 minutes after the last shuts off. They keep time accurately and I have never had to adjust their clocks due to one being slow or fast. The rain delay feature is nice, as is the manual run feature. If you live where it freezes, just make sure you remove and drain the timer during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lobdell

customer_reviews.title: Orbit 3-port Digital Timer from Amazon Service LLC missing all additional parts
customer_reviews.text: My shipment arrived in a 9.5" x 6.5" x 4.5" box that contained the timer, installation and operating instructions but missing all 7 parts listed in the instructions as included. One of the part is a bracket that is meant to anchor the bottom of the timer to the wall after the timer is threaded into to the garden faucet. Not sure if the bracket can even fit inside the box I received. Appear's I received a previously returned product. Am returning the product back to Amazon since it's incomplete and not sure I want to reorder the same model again from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeejunkie

customer_reviews.title: Warranty coverage is a lie...
customer_reviews.text: Product quit working well before "warranty" expired. Tried the chat feature of their website to no avail. Emailed and received a response once. When I replied that I had a defective device, no replies followed. Tried calling the 800-919-8590 number that is listed through Amazon, not a working number. Looked on the Orbit website for a phone number, but did not find one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dail

customer_reviews.title: Common problem !!! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought last year but didnt get system hooked up and running until about 2 to 3 weeks ago. I thought this was working fine until I went outside this evening and found it was still running for over 24 hours!!. I did a manual watering last night set for 60 minutes. It never stopped! Not sure what to do now. I usually read the comments. Guess I didnt this time because it seems to be a common issue!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program and works great. Have had no issues other than some banging pipes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this timer three months ago and waited to write this review until I used the product for a while. It’s easy to program, and has worked perfectly for three months. I have had no issues. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because it does bang my pipes pretty loudly. I bought another timer that I have been using at the same time and that one doesn’t bang my pipes. Other than that it works great and I’ve had no issues and I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ST711

customer_reviews.title: Keeps leaking
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 at the same time for front and back of house. First worked for 1 summer perfectly. Took indoors for the winter. Following summer continues to leak after timer ends. Requires manual water shutoff. Very poor construction. Second worked well first summer initially but by the end of the summer started to leak slightly from housing. Put out the next summer and was leaking internally like a sieve. If Orbit had any decency they would not sell this or at least price it for single summer use.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper212

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I truly am blown away at this product (the idea and quality of it). Granted, I've only had it for two weeks but it has already streamlined & automated my property watering schedule. We have a rather large yard so we have 3 sprinklers with this timer in the back and the same in the front. It works perfect and I no longer have to go outside to manually water the yard. We'll see how the quality keeps up during the brutally hot NC summers; I do not plan to keep it out in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Not tech savvy? Super simple set-up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mom who seriously struggles with tech... I’m talkin’ 90s era universal remotes can pose a problem. Was worried she’d have difficulty programming the timer on this but it’s awesomely simple and she was able to follow a YouTube instruction video that we texted her. She said the written instructions are easy to follow too. She’s had it for a couple weeks and loves it. Not sure about the weatherproofing since it’s so new but so far it’s withstood some heavy rains just fine.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I like this product just fine. Works great and simple as anything to operate. Two things I would change: make the threaded connections brass instead of plastic, and have the valves shut softly. When this turns off the flow, it snaps shut a little violently. Overall it has been working great for about 6 weeks
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, durable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this water-timer for three years, now, and it works as advertised. Durable, easy to program, and does its job. I only needed to change the batteries once so far. I started a new lawn from seed in both my front and back yards in Autsin, Texas. The heat tends to kill even established grass in the dry and hot summers. My lawn looks great as a result of getting regular waterings, even when I am out of town on a summer vacation. Best thing short of a full-blown underground sprinkler system, and much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Page

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always shut off!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I've bought. First two were at another house and left them there, now with a new home I decided to pick up another for the sprinkler in the back and topping off the pool on a schedule. After watering the yard for 45 minutes, I switched valves and set it to do the pool for 30 minutes and went inside. Woke up today and the pool is overfilled. When it reaches 1 minute, instead of shutting off, it jumps the timer to 55 minutes (which I have never set to do 55 minutes). This model is absolutely junk. It's just outside of the return period too. I will not be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 months...
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 9 months. TIP: Go to the manufacturer's web site and look at the reviews for product #56082. 50% are 1 star... on the manufacturer's own web site! If you're wondering why this product has a 4 star average here, it's because Amazon reviewers write their reviews within the first week or two of ownership. This skews the ratings much higher for products that work well initially, but fail over a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Sj773Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Would be good
customer_reviews.text: Worked great first season, go to fire them up and they don't work. Packaging says warranty is six years. Online pdf says one year unless packaging says others. Company doesnt't actually follow warranty or replace items. Expensive for a one-season product
customer_reviews.author: Lauren G

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design or valves?
customer_reviews.text: The timer functions as advertised, but doesn't open fast enough to allow 3 popup sprinkles to fully pop-up creating ponds at sprinklers and a lack of coverage. Yeah I know people are going to say it's a water pressure issue or an old timer. However the sprinklers pop up just fine when the supply line is connected straight to the spicot without the timer.. So pressure to the timer is not the issue. Also I bought this item new, returned the first one as defective, and have the same issue with the replacement. Thus the timers are somehow restricting the water flow enough, not to allow pop-ups to function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Bret V

customer_reviews.title: I've been waiting for a chance to rate this unit!
customer_reviews.text: I have a closet full of battery operated watering timers. The first ones (decades ago) required an engineering degree to operate, and I kept laminated directions taped to them. Others were simpler to operate, but not convenient to use. Example: if you manually ran the timer at a different time than it was set to go off automatically, it would change the run time. This unit is simple and does everything right. You don't even need the directions to program it. I liked it so much that I bought two more. I cannot imagine anybody designing an easier-to-use timer. If you need a timer, this is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Moi Aussi

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: Pulled this out of the package, seemingly well built. It is plastic, but seems to be built heavy. Keeps on time as expected and all of the settings are done through a knob which is easy to understand. If I had one request, I would like to be able to program two separate sprinkler times, one in the evening to give a standard watering and one in the heat of the day to relieve heat stress, but I am happy with what I have right now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miller

customer_reviews.title: This timer failed after 2 years (used in summer only).
customer_reviews.text: I have other Orbit hose timers and they have all lasted more than two seasons. This one has failed after two seasons. I use them to water flowers, herbs, and a few tomatoes. At this price, I expected it to last much longer. The timer appears to work, but the solenoid does not open (just a click, but no water), even with new batteries. The manual setting will not even show on the digital screen. The warranty for this should be more than 1 year!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Marchetti

customer_reviews.title: Not weather resistant!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a weather resistant timer. I repeat: NOT WEATHER RESISTANT. I bought six of those for my wife's garden. I left them outdoors for a summer, and kept them in the garage during the winter. Out of 6 timers, 2 has malfunctioned. Apparently, the water leaked inside, and caused a shirtcircuit. I noticed that there is a fog and drops of water under the screen of LCD. When this happen, the timer starts to "switch off" on its own. In addition, setting them is a pain. There's no energy-independent memory; every time you need to re-program them, you need to do it from scratch. Programming interface is poorly designed and hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Major durability issues with an otherwise great product
customer_reviews.text: This timer worked for one season and turned into a sieve the next. I’m very disappointed in the durability of this timer. When winter came, I stored it indoors in a large Tupperware bin. When spring arrived, I took it out and set it up again. It was leaking water everywhere as if all of the internal gaskets and seals were broken. It still worked for about a week, but eventually died completely. It’s a shame too, the timer worked perfectly for what I wanted. It was easy to set up and it worked like clockwork. The durability issue is so big though, I would not buy it again or recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Utah

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. MODEL CONSITENTLY MALFUNCTIONS Update: after having one replaced for malfunctioning as described below, I bought one more hoping the same problem wouldnt happen again, but I was wrong, and yet again a bunch of water was wasted and certain sectors didnt get the water they needed because this one just stayed running. When properly set it worked accordingly for a couple weeks and then would just stay on for hours with no warning. This is a problem because it misdirected water usage from other sectors on my property and plants die because we have limited water to use.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this unit for 2 years now and I’m going to order a new one. We live in Phoenix and this unit is subject to early morning until noon intense sun because of where the faucet/hose is for our pool. It works well and is very easy to program. It’s a single button push to do a manual operation to turn the water on during a very hot dry stretch of weather. I’m ordering a new one because the display window has become discolored and tough to read. It’s just part of living in the desert sun. I’m going to try to figure out some kind of cover to protect the screen. Otherwise I’m very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic threads go away in one year!
customer_reviews.text: One Year.... this has "soft" plastic parts that screw onto the bib which is metal. The angle on our bib to facilitate the PVC water lines is about 15 degrees. We took this off carefully three times due to cold snaps... and I MEAN carefully because I saw it was plastic. By the third effort at screwing it back onto the bib it had eaten two of the top four threads and would not hold. If you have to remove your timer for cold weather, BUY another model or brand. Disgusted with such cheapness.
customer_reviews.author: RoamingDoc

customer_reviews.title: Find another solution, this isn't it
customer_reviews.text: Works as it's supposed to sometimes. However, the majority of the time when it's set to 'Auto' it will turn on for the timed 8 minute run but never shut off. And, many of the times used in Manual mode it won't turn off after the set time of run. I've gotten to the point where I only use it when I'm standing next to it so it doesn't overwater and kill all my plants again. Which means I don't use it for what it was made for or what I bought it for. Find another solution, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: rowari

customer_reviews.title: Two Major Problems
customer_reviews.text: Two problems: 1) The options for setting the timer are limited to watering every 6 hours, 12 hours, 24 hours, and then every day (and you can set the day from 1 to 7). If you need to water at a more frequent or a specific interval, there is no option to do so. 2) The manual overrides are only for spigot 1. Meaning you can turn spigot 1 on and off at will and set a rain delay for spigot 1 (again in 24 hours increments only). But I can't figure out how to set a manual override for spigot 2 (and I'm generally pretty good with gizmos). The instructions provide no explanation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Pressure rating too low.  Reliability not warranted.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2. Both failed about the same time in 3 categories. Both started leaking internally. It isn’t unusual for city water pressures to spike up over 100 psi during low demand times. This one is rated up to 100 psi. Both units failed to cut off automatically. Think about that the next time your headed out of town for a day or so. Both units began to lose timer setting and even change settings. Moving the dial on both will now short out settings At $30 per, I expected a longer use than a few months. I have bought a lot of Orbit products, but this is a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Joeizme

customer_reviews.title: Water hammer and needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: There's no leaks (yet), so it's great in that regard. I also like the timer functionality, that part is easy to use. One issue is water hammer - something that is very dangerous in my old home - from the valves shutting off too quickly. I would give 4 or 5 stars (assuming nothing else breaks) if it wasn't for that. The other issues is they need to have a "manual mode" dial that is not bound to a timer. At present, you have to set it to "Auto" then hit the manual button and set a timer for how long you want to be in manual mode. It's not a big deal, but mildly inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Sisko

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy To Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I got this to water my wife's outdoor plants while on vacation. It runs on two AA batteries and was very easy to set up without even referencing the instructions. The frequency/duration options allowed for a good amount of schedule flexibility. I connected a sprinkler to it and set it up to spray over the plants twice a day. The weather was much hotter than expected while we were out of town and the plants were looking good when we returned, so it did its job. I am happy with the purchase and would recommend this to anyone needing automatic outdoor watering of plants or lawns.
customer_reviews.author: FunkHouse9

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this for my garden for several months and my plants are thriving and if I leave town I don’t have to water. I love the dual spout so I could connect a hose to the other side for other uses. Super easy to set up and use. I like the manual function too so I can give my plants some extra water on those extra hot days. Or the skip function is nice to prevent over watering.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: holds up in outdoor conditions about 1-2 years
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different brands/types of water timers and this is simply the easiest to program and change. The large knob control is easy to read and use, not requiring numerous button pushes to activate common functions. The unit is reasonably well sealed and withstands sunlight and water well (you'd think any of them would, but it's not my experience). Unfortunately, as other reviewers have stated, they eventually begin leaking internally. (no I didn't allow it to freeze) This causes the unit to fail, until it is dried out and new batteries inserted. I am away from home for many weeks at a time, and reliability is paramount. These are not.
customer_reviews.author: Rbimd

customer_reviews.title: Initially reported low flow rate (fix!)
customer_reviews.text: The Flow Rate on this unit is so low that it can't power a standard sprinkler. The throw with a standard sprinkler is so low that it will not reset the directional catch. The sprinkler just waters in one place. You have one job. You should do it well. UPDATE: There is a mess filter on the inlet to the timer. The mess was pushed in during the packing or shipping process. I just used my finger to straighten out the filter and the water flow is now perfectly fine. Everything else works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Really costs $50 not $30 because of water-hammer
customer_reviews.text: Works fine so far. It's necessary to buy a water-hammer arrestor to go with it. That means it really costs $45-50, not $30. (You can pay from about $15 to upwards of $40 on Amazon for the same arrestor.) If you don't use an arrestor, the water-hammer has to go somewhere. It may make a loud bang when the timer shuts off, or it may bust your pipes, or the timer may just spring a leak; but in any event you need the arrestor to prevent more expense down the road. If I'd known that before I bought my timer, I'd have paid more for a different model.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Only had the unit for a few weeks and at first it worked great. Then when I used the manual timer it ...
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the other reviews about the unit not turning off, and that was my mistake. Only had the unit for a few weeks and at first it worked great. Then when I used the manual timer it wouldn't shut off and my garden/yard got soaked. The a few days later scheduled timer wouldn't turn off. It would start watering at the correct time, but it would never turn off. Went out of town, but luckily I had my neighbor check it to be sure it turned off. It he hadn't, it would have been watering the small garden for about a week. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Find something else.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. I think Orbit is a good company and the design is sound. But I should have read the reviews. Ok so it leaks a little, I could live with that. But when I hooked it up to my oscillating sprinkler the water stream only went up about 2 feet. I bypassed it and connected my hose to the spigot and got full pressure again shooting up 12 feet as it should. I think its a quality issue that the units are not inspected for leaks and pressure loss. Sending it back today and won't take a chance on a replacement. Do you want to chance it?
customer_reviews.author: T. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: is it worth trying?
customer_reviews.text: I set duration to 10 minutes, it flooded my backyard overnight because IT DID NOT TURN OFF as expected. sometimes it works, even tested it multiple times and it worked. however, that first time it did not and wasted a lot of water. I adjusted duration to 15 minutes but when I manually turn it on, display shows 10 minutes anyways. then I go back to set duration and it shows 15 minutes. It is being offered way cheaper than when I bought it, these may be the reasons why!
customer_reviews.author: Elmer M Ignacio

customer_reviews.title: Be Ready for a Waterlogged Lawn
customer_reviews.text: Water doesn't turn off when it is supposed to. Setup a simple program to turn on every 12 hours for 30 minutes. I get home from work and find it had been watering for 9 hours straight and my yard was a puddle. Screen said "Next watering time scheduled in 3 hours". The Water symbol that is there when it is watering was not present. Yet water was coming out of the sprinklers. Glad I spent numerous hours of my time getting my lawn ready to plant new grass only to have it all undone by a horrible product. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barish

customer_reviews.title: Stay away! Do not over-rely on this for your garden.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after only 6 months... no guarantee, no way to get a replacement. The display stayed on, but the valve won't open. Fortunately, I noticed my plants were getting dry or this broken timer would have killed my garden. I'd stay away from this unless you want to replace it every few months or it's not critical to the health of your garden and you can check it every day. Waste of money... look for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: MauiShadow

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water, plan ahead.
customer_reviews.text: Manual mode runs one of three hoses not all simultaneously. The device has cheap plastic connector that leaks water. First, took it apart and plumbers tape to all connections, and put back together, lost two of the screws, so used gorilla tape to verify device closed. The leak is between device and connector, lots of plumber tape and liquid plastic was used to seal the leak. Plumber’s putty wasn’t working to well for me. Plan on buying plumbers tape, teflon tape and liquid rubber/plumbers putty to stop the leaking or go with another model until model is upgraded to use quality connectors.
customer_reviews.author: FDR

customer_reviews.title: You better have flood insurance if you buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon return window closed two days ago and this product just flooded my garden for the third time in three weeks. I've setup the time and schedule multiple times and it still can't start and stop when it's supposed to. About a week ago I settled for just using the manual watering option. Click the button, set the length of time, and it should shut off as scheduled. I set it for 15 minutes and 45 minutes later it was still running and flooding my garden. This is a horrible product and I will never buy another Orbit product.
customer_reviews.author: PiEmAn

customer_reviews.title: Deal killer due to poor design.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a design flaw that is a deal killer as far as I am concerned. If you have just seeded a new lawn area and want to keep the bed moist, so the seeds will germinate, you will want to do several waterings a day. Certainly at least two. Well with this cleverly designed gadget, you have the choices of once a day, every six hours, day and night, or every twelve hours, day and night...and that's it. Sorry, but that is bad design and inadequate. Deal killer.
customer_reviews.author: Occupying Force

customer_reviews.title: heat damage and bad threads
customer_reviews.text: i gave bought many of these. they are great , usually and until they stop. 3 of 5 stopped within 2 years. i suspect heat damage to circuitry as proposed by another reviewer. new problem this time. Plastic threads were damaged or defective on arrival. i very carefully threaded it onto high quality metal threads and it would not thread on correctly. unfortunately didnt open the package until after return window. new setup will give the timers shade, hopefully they will last over 2 years. check threads when you get them.
customer_reviews.author: knotdot

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was that this was a pretty cool device. Easy to set up and program, and was exactly what I needed. Hooked it up and it leaked out of EVERYWHERE, in a major fashion. It leaked out of the top. It leaked out of the bottom. It leaked out of places it shouldn't have leaked. I went to a local store and bought new washers for it, confident that that would solve the problem. Then it leaked some more. Leaked like crazy. You should know - this thing leaks. I do not recommend. Why? Because it leaks like crazy. Edit: Finally ordered these Silicone washers for it and was able to get it to stop leaking:
customer_reviews.author: Music&Coffee

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality, leaks all over right out of box
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up right out of the box, all excited to have a solution to my need of watering some new trees while I travel. Leaks all over the place, coming from the cheapo plastic hookup and from inside the unit somewhere. I should have listened to the reviews. This is truly a major piece of junk. I'm going to try and get one that works from the company or return this to Amazon. The timer mechanism itself seems nice -- too bad they can't use a bit of metal in this thing, as it's all leaky plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Bill F.

customer_reviews.title: I have several different brands and like this the best.
customer_reviews.text: This one works like it should. However, note that the valve may not work properly if the water pressure is too low. The hose connectors are plastic. The user interface is very good. The batteries held charge for a year, although I did not use it in the winter. Don't let them get below freezing. I have two. One of them sometimes leaks slightly, so probably this could be a problem if used inside, which is why I knocked off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Reed White

customer_reviews.title: no more than 6 months, it start to leak ...
customer_reviews.text: no more than 6 months, it start to leak..... it's not the connection between hose and water timer.....water timer start to leak......
customer_reviews.author: OKToki

customer_reviews.title: Will not shut of after cycle is done.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these timers. So far 2 of them have problems shutting off after the cycle is completed. One was over a year old when it started malfunctioning. The other one malfunctioned 2 weeks after we got it brand new. That can lead to a tremendous water overuse and lose. You will see that others have had this problem , so it isn’t isolated occurrence. I like everything else about the ease of operation. Wish it wasn’t so. Look at the reviews for other companies and choose wisely.
customer_reviews.author: woodmanhugh

customer_reviews.title: If you like flooding your gardens and wasting water, this works great.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked for approximately 2 weeks then suddenly when set for 21 minutes ran 24 hours straight, flooding my vegetable garden which is not really great for the plants that are now dying. Looking at it, it seems to be bouncing up and down between the 21 minutes it was set for and then down to 17 and back up... it's stuck in an odd loop. I can no longer trust this product and had hoped it would keep my gardens good for an extended trip we are to take soon. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Koltcz

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, then quick, but in the "open " position.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a number of these and this one is holding up well. The problem I keep having is they fail in the open mode and I have a huge water bill. Hoping this won't be the case, but so far, so good. Update 7/20 - stage coincidence that shortly after writing a review the item cocked out. Thankfully there was a float in the pool that kept the timer from just allowing water to run all the time. Really bummed because it had worked so we'll. Hoping I can return or get a warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ballew

customer_reviews.title: Product failed after 2 weeks.  Third Orbit product to fail in last year.
customer_reviews.text: Timer failed after 2 weeks. Writing on screen only partially visible. Checked batteries but they were fine. After I hit reset button, digits on screen started advancing without stop. This is the third Orbit timer that failed me this year. The other two were purchased a year ago and had similar problems this year. I thought I was just unlucky with those first two and possibly shouldn't expect more than a year of working service, but this third one lasted only 2 weeks. The timer interface is deceptively simple and attractive, but is of little use if it fails so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Silver

customer_reviews.title: Restricts water flow
customer_reviews.text: I added this timer to a hose run that had 2 sprinkler heads and was working fine prior to the addition of the timer. Once the timer was operational, the water pressure through the timer was reduced to the point where the sprinkler heads wouldn't rotate. After removing the timer, everything worked as before.
customer_reviews.author: noname

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Understand right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, I pulled out the instructions because I've dedicated too many hours toward exploring complex faucet timer settings in the past. But once I got halfway through, I realized I didn't need to because the device was designed so that each setting way easy to understand, access, and set. The dial makes it easy to configure your watering schedule, whether you are a first-time user or just need to tweak your watering schedule years after losing the instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Used for a year, no problems at all. It's in an exposed area and gets rain and extreme full sun. It worked as I had it set, 20 minutes a day at 10am for the horse trough. The digital display is as good as ever. Seals are tight, even the plastic housing hasn't faded. Super easy (didn't need instructions) to set and change the timer. You install batteries, set the clock and then punch in time you want to start and for how long and how often. Haven't tried rain delay. Super intuitive and whole year later I'm still on original batteries.
customer_reviews.author: MSJ

customer_reviews.title: Box missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrive without the six(6) items for mounting product to wall. Box was sealed allegedly as from manf. Seems like this would be a checklist thing given the relatively low overall quantity of parts. Product works as designed. Very simple, hose attached timer for 1, 2 and/or 3 zones. Needs a fourth outlet for always on hose because you have to disconnect one of the 3 outlets for manual watering. Not convenient. Low priced. 10-month update: Really don't like the manual watering feature. Would be much simpler to have just a on/off button to bypass the timer feature. Perhaps thats why the low price.
customer_reviews.author: W.A.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the threading.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic used, or the threading itself, of the pipe connections could be better. Wrapped a couple of rotations of basic plumbers tape around a brass male end and the female on the Orbit sheared its first thread. I did manage to seat and work it on successfully after a few tries but without the tape. Would happily pay an extra $10+ for this item if it was metal... The programing is a cinch and it tested okay. Hopefully the lifespan is longer than some have experienced. Lawn timers are just one of those markets (like home security cameras) that doesn't seem have a solid performer at a consumer price point.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gadget for busy, forgetful or lazy gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these for years in my yard. Every summer I seem to add more to make watering easier. I love flowers but hate to stand and water. It’s very intuitive to program. When I winterize, I bring them indoors and remove the batteries. I’ve found if you leave the batteries inside over the winter, they deteriorate and will ruin the thing. These gadgets are electronic so do eventually die, but honestly, I think I’ve owned some for 5-7 years. Maybe longer.
customer_reviews.author: Angela D.

customer_reviews.title: Understand - This allows once-a-day watering ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: If you Understand that this item only allows once-a-day watering it may be 4-5 star rated. The major let down is that... while this item is easy to learn and use... there is no way to program it for multiple waterings each day. This means you become a slave to the unit if you are using it to water NEW plants, trees, grass or seed. If you have a mature lawn, etc ... this unit may be PERFECT for you! Orbit does make a wifi controlled unit which allows 3 watering and more so consider carefully this expensive device.
customer_reviews.author: c&ekessler

customer_reviews.title: Major water pressure loss
customer_reviews.text: Cut my water pressure by 40%, so much so that my sprinkler would not reach all areas of the garden that it did prior to timer set up. Otherwise, the timer setting seems to work as intended and was very easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Harper

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for  a month...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this timer's easy to understand interface with large buttons, reviews were great, so I ordered the timer at the end of June 2016. Unfortunately I received a defective unit. The timer worked well for 4 weeks, but then the display started flashing, implying that it needs new batteries. I've replaced the batteries and kept an eye on it for a day - the timer worked. I then went away on business for a week. Came back to find my garden was dry, some flowers have died. The timer was flashing/needing the batteries. Again???!!?? I've replaced the batteries 3 times with the same result. The timer appears to be working for a day or two, and then fails.
customer_reviews.author: zanoza

customer_reviews.title: Good deals for the $$ and works great, as expected
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews, but bought anyways(ha!). I have one for our front and back yard. I also installed a Mini Rester to stop the water hammer when it shuts off. I didn't think I needed it, but it I did after hearing it after the first use. Has the features I need and works well. I've had water splash on this and it seems to be holding up. The batter compartment in the back is nice and sealed and no signs of any moisture. Cold season is coming, so just took them off and stored them for spring/summer use next year(took batteries out as well).
customer_reviews.author: Islasian4life

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Just like many other reviews I had problems with leaking. This is a great little system if they would only fix the leak problem. Perhaps it's done intentionally so it needs to be replaced every year. As others have mentioned, it worked great throughout the summer. I brought it in for winter but when I went to use it in the spring it leaked inside the unit. This is the 2nd unit I have purchased. I'm going to try to prevent the leak on the next one using the instructions one reviewer recommended. Hopefully, this will allow it to work for years.
customer_reviews.author: Doey

customer_reviews.title: Great timer for a DIY sprinkler system.
customer_reviews.text: I have created a DIY sprinkler system around my house. I have around 200 feet of space around the house that is mostly around 15 feet wide. In the past, I have moved a hose and sprinkler around the house. This took a lot of time and effort. I build a system of 10 sprinkler heads that are above ground and mostly next to the house. In building this, I created 3 zones, one with 4 heads and the other two with 3 heads each. This timer is used to work one of the zones with 3 heads. The other two zones are controlled by a timer just like this one except it controls two zones.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: This item is not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this in March 2020. Set it up with no problems, worked great until....it rained heavily. Entire unit was worthless. Contacted the Manufacturer, Orbit, for suggestions. Their reply was the unit is not waterproof. It was explained to me that I should have taken the unit inside if it was going to rain! Wait what? A outdoor watering system that is not waterproof? Orbit did send me a replacement at no cost which is great customer service. I will be placing a plastic bag around the unit for future rainy days. I recommend this product, just be sure to cover it so the display doesn't get wet.
customer_reviews.author: MGio334

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Developed an internal leak after about 6 weeks of use. Then the next day the display quit working. Water must have created an internal short. Batteries get hot. Orbit generally makes good products, but I'm finding their warranty is useless. Their website doesn't work for either chat or contact us. Their phone customer service has limited hours and horribly long wait times. The packaging contains no instructions on how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Rockdodger

customer_reviews.title: After 3 years of use in Pennsylvania I am getting a 2nd for another watering system.
customer_reviews.text: My original one is still going strong so I got this one for the front of the house flour beds. The first one isnusednfirbthe back vegetable beds. I take the unit inside for the winter and take the batteries out as well. I use the same batteries as the previous year and I get another full season out of them. I run it every 12 hours and for about 20 minutes for each cycle. The front unit runs a bleeder hose same interval but 30 minutes per cycle. Well made and sturdy/rugged. I highly recommend this unit for a single hose watering system. I have one running a drip irrigation and the others the bleeder system.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 yr and 2 months.. then kaput.
customer_reviews.text: It was good for the first year, and it must have known that the warranty was up. Bought it 5/6/16.. died 7/10/17 This summer it started to leak internally, and the LCD started going out. Somehow it came back on, but it would not keep the programmed settings, and would flash like it was resetting. I changed the batteries thinking that might help the issue, but it's still doing the same thing. I would not recommend this product. Good Job Orbit, you got my money once, but never again. *During the off season, it was stored the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. My timer leaks from the attachment to the tap. I think the threads were not manufactured properly (I made sure to thread it to the tap gently, so it wasn't damaged in the process). I am truly disappointed as I had to ship internationally to return it. Fortunately, Amazon helped me resolved this issue in a productive way. I shop Amazon because I don't ever have to worry about faulty products, they have my back. This product either works or arrives dead on arrival. I am guessing their quality control is deficient.
customer_reviews.author: Volvoholic

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This little timer provides an easy-to-install and reliable alternative to labor-intensive installation sprinkler and watering systems. Combined with hoses for soaking it provides an amazing value. I have been switching increasingly to using these timers in the last few years with great results. I've had to replace batteries every year or two, and have had the timers go bad after 3+ years. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Coburn

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully a fluke malfunction.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought two of these timers this summer and they went far to make my life easier. Until one just quit working a few weeks ago and it is to late to return the item for replacement. Something inside of it must have popped and water was continually gushing through one port. So disappointed and unable to do anything about it. Hopefully my other one doesn't break as well. I think a product this pricey should last more than three months.
customer_reviews.author: Travelinmomma

customer_reviews.title: I've deployed 19 of these over 3 years and they're all working (nearly) perfectly
customer_reviews.text: In fact, they're ALL still using the original AA batteries--something that astonishes me. Years ago a landscaper friend advised me to avoid Orbit products regardless of price. I think it was good advice then, but no longer a good categorical judgment I kept a close eye on the first ones, but now it's set & forget. The one glitch I had (one of the 19 repeated its watering 6 hours out of schedule) never repeated. Another timer--a more expensive Orbit using two AAA batteries suffered battery failure after only two months. But that's irrelevant to this model.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Summers

customer_reviews.title: My back yard lawn is now taken care of 24x7 without any attention
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of turning on/off my water supply and decided to try out this after some good feedback. After connecting to my home faucet and a couple of easy to set dial based settings, now it works like charm. It has a couple of other settings like every 12hrs.. I ends up using every day at 5 AM to water the lawn. To help to water those plants manually, I connected 4 way water connect and water hose is connected to one of those connect. I just switch one of those connector on for manual. It is working beautifully - easy to set and forget it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Timer function is buggy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for couple of months, but the timer function started functioning weird. It turns on by itself randomly and starts watering. I had one outlet connected to a drip line to some of my potted plants. In addition to the scheduled program, this turned on unknown to us and ran all night waterlogging several plants. Yesterday night it went through this automatic cycle several times (we heard the clicking noise when it turns on and off, but didn't suspect this was the cause) and caused waterlogging again and wasted a lot of water.
customer_reviews.author: gsappar

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: This worked ok for the first summer. Unhooked it for the winter. Now it shows as 'empty battery'. Changed batteries twice and still no luck. Tried wiping off the contacts with a dry towel to see if there was a speck of dirt on the contacts. Still no luck. It looks as though it is on - indicates time and start to run time, but shows as battery empty or low. Replaced batteries again. Still no contact. Good buy if you only want it for a short time. If you want to use it for more than one season, Stay Away from this one!
customer_reviews.author: Judy M.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to program
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this timer. I liked the first one so well, that I bought another. What I don't like about most timers is having to get out the instructions each time I need to reprogram them. This timer, however, is completely intuitive — turn the dial to the right position, and enter the settings. Why other timers can't be this simple to set, I have no idea. By the way, the timer also works. My first one is at least three years old and still going strong. My only complain are the plastic fittings. I wish they were metal, but so far, it's not been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to set up. The only pitfall is that the number on the screen indicating the port you are setting parameters for is small. It's pretty easy to inadvertently change the wrong one. Otherwise it couldn't be easier! Just turn the dial, set it, turn it and set the next parameter, etc. I like the manual feature for when the lawn needs more water or just to check the sprinklers.
customer_reviews.author: NoPickle

customer_reviews.title: AVOID! Will stop working after few months
customer_reviews.text: This unit was a breathe to install and setup but started resetting randomly after 10 months or so. Eventually it completely shutdown and refused to reset and work. After examining it, it appears that the unit leaked inside the PCB and ruined the unit. The internal water-proofing is lacking and this unit will DIE sooner than later. Contacted support and after a short exchange they stopped replying and completely ignored my ticket. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: M. Taha

customer_reviews.title: I love them, but they don't last
customer_reviews.text: I've bought probably 10 to 15 of these units over the last few years. Overall, I love them, but they just don't last. I end up replacing 3 or more a year. They just start acting funny...powering on and off randomly, not keeping time, not letting the water by, etc. (even though I replace the batteries). I still use these units because they work, at least for 9 months before they start failing and they are cheap and easy to use...but I wish they lasted longer. Some do last a year or two...but I don't get a year out of most of them.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead after 3 weeks use
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked fine for about 3 weeks, then I noticed the sprinkling system was still running when I got up in the morning (I usually water at night). The Unit said "P P" on the front, so I consulted the manual. It said nothing about "P P" so I changed the batteries. Nothing happened. The unit is complete dead. And of course it died just a few days out of Amazon's return policy. So I have a dead unit that does nothing, and I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: David Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Can't run both outputs at the same time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this assuming it would allow output to both outlet ports at the same time. It will not. The second most frustrating part is the schedule. You can only choose every "X" days (up to 7). I live in a city with watering restrictions, and my designated days are Wednesday and Saturday. There is no number of days that I can choose that will allow me to hit those assigned days. If you can live with these limitations - great ... product might work for you. But to me, it is a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barney

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last more than a year!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product last a year if that! We removed the timer at the end of summer, stored in our garage so that it would work the next summer but as usual, it didn't work. Contacted the customer support and now I am told that I have a 40 minute wait time on the phone. We have been purchasing Orbit products for all our rentals and we have experienced the same issue over and over. An outdoors product like a timer should last more than 3 months of summer.
customer_reviews.author: John Adams

customer_reviews.title: Constantly malfunction, impossible to file warranty claim
customer_reviews.text: Constantly malfunction!!! Terible customer service! I have lost over $400 of fruit trees this year to faulty timers. I bought 15 orbit times and out of the box 1 did not work and 2 more stopped working a week later. They either do not open or they stay open and drain my water tank so the rest of my garden and orchard gets no water. Tried to contact customer service and after waiting on hold for over 1 hour gave up. They claim there is a warranty but there is no way to file one online and no way to talk to someone. If you purchase this, good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought two - one works, the other doesn't.  Would like Orbit to replace the one that doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these. One works fine. The other one is defective - it will not shut off the water once it's been activated, even when turning the dial to "OFF". I've tried contacting the manufacturer for a replacement, but was put on terminal hold after telling me in a recorded message how much they value offering great customer service. Orbit, if you read your reviews, please reach out with a phone number or email to a real person who can help me.
customer_reviews.author: Kat R

customer_reviews.title: This is so unreliable just don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this timer. We installed it and a couple of weeks later noticed it wasn’t working. Changed the batteries and had to reset all the programming. A couple of weeks later again it stopped working. Changed the batteries again and had to reset it again. Today it stopped again, I could hear it hammering on and off but the water wasn’t coming on. The screen again showed low battery icon with nothing else. I removed the batteries and put the same ones back in and the screen lit back up. This is so unreliable just don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda P

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: We bought this faucet timer so that we'd keep my wife's flowers watered while we were out of town. You can configure the timer to work in many different ways. We set ours to work a 1/2 hour in the morning and a 1/2 hour in the evening. We could see the sprinkler working with our security camera and it appeared to function on schedule without any leaks. I am storing this item in our basement as we live in Michigan and there's a possibility of the frozen water inside damaging the internals.
customer_reviews.author: 101Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with it and I would buy it again. Now, I do have one minor "problem" and I don't know why it happens. For example; - I use it manually for X amount of minutes and it ends, - I repeat the same X minutes and I do it all over again and I do this for 2-3 more consecutive time. - When that 4 or 5 time finishes, it repeats again the same X minutes. Make sense? I've found that the time finishes and it starts all over again without me touching it even if it's in manual mode.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only one season
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this timer while it worked. It was easy to set up and reliable for watering my vegetable garden. It didn’t leak. The battery lasted a long time too. Unfortunately, mine stopped working after the first season. Perhaps I wasn’t supposed to store it in my shed over the winter? It was dry and had the batteries removed. Just a no go the next spring. A little disappointing. I might shop around to see if I can find something better.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

product_meta.title: Orbit 56082 3-Outlet Hose Watering Timer, Green
product_meta.description: Size:3 OutletThe Orbit 3 Outlet Digital Watering Timer will turn your hose faucet into a programmed sprinkler system in minutes. No more dead plants because you forgot to water them. No more soggy lawns because you forgot to turn the water off. Just set the timer and go! With a large digital display, oversized dial, and simple controls, programming is fast and easy. Built with high quality materials and water-resistant construction, you can count on many years of dependable service.
feature_bullets: Rain delay feature for water conservation
Manual bypass allow you to use your faucet without interrupting timed watering
